abstract: Dr Patrick Haggard study in journal Current Biology finds some poelpe feel less responsible for negative actions if coerced by others to take them, suggesting laws should penalize those who give orders to greater degree than those who follow them.
lead_paragraph: In a study, test subjects felt more removed from the consequences of a decision if they are ordered to carry it out.

headline.main: Coercion May Make People Feel Less Responsible for Actions
headline.print_headline: Psychology: Coercion May Make People Feel Less Responsible

snippet: In a study, test subjects felt more removed from the consequences of a decision if they are ordered to carry it out.
